attributes.action: Reinstate the fracking ban and up support for renewables
attributes.background: We ask that the government reinstate the ban on fracking so our country can deliver on much needed climate commitments to rapidly cut emissions, and to ensure investment in safe, resilient and zero carbon alternatives.
attributes.additional_details:
At a time when the country needs a solution to both the cost of living and climate crises, fracking will only set us back.  It will halt progress towards tackling the former, and at best providing temporary respite from the latter but with the real risk of extra investment needed to mitigate various risks associated with this water intensive, polluting and poorly regulated technology.

We call for the ban to be reinstated and for greater investment in renewable energy.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Ofgem is already required to set a price cap for energy, but the decision on how this is set is a matter for Ofgem and not the UK Government or Parliament.

attributes.action: Leave the UNWEF and the WHO
attributes.background: For the health of the nation and its people we must resign our membership of and commitments to these global governance bodies.
attributes.additional_details:
The UNWEF and WHO are unelected bodies which are passing down edicts which pose a serious threat to our economy, the health a security of the nation, and humanity as a whole.

In a matter of a few short weeks we have seen food, energy, private transport, money and now even sex be attempted to be regulated by these organisations.  

These organisations pose a clear and present danger to the Nation and its people.  We must oppose them.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for aa similar action:

End the UK’s membership of the World Health Organisation: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617450

We're not sure what you mean by "UNWEF". If you mean the World Economic Forum, the UK is not a member of this organisation.

attributes.action: No to Green levy on energy bills and Ofgem to cap all price increases Now.
attributes.background: Stop  the Green levy on all energy bills, on £3000.00 £1250.00 Tax, for Petrol every 4.5 litres ( 1 gallon ) cost £10.00 tax £8.00 , cut the price £0.70p to £1.30p per litres this will bring inflation down.
attributes.additional_details: We have Oil in the North Sea drill for it. Gas frack for it, Coal open the mines. We are self sufficient in all of the above, it will take 40 years to build Nuclear power stations to supply the whole of the U.K. Wind farms only last 10 years only run at 50 percent can't store energy useless, solar farms only work well in the Summer. Stop lying to the people, have you learned nothing in the last few years relying on other Countries. Make the U.K. Great again build it all in the U.K.

attributes.action: Use the next Energy Windfall to fund loans for easier access to Renewables.
attributes.background: Rather than keep giving Energy cost handouts, use a Fund generated from Windfall Tax on Energy companies to allow homeowners access to 'FREE' financing of renewables. This is paid back via a second meter reading, at say, 15p/kwh. Paid with existing bill until a point the cost has been repaid.
attributes.additional_details: Renewables have a 'payback period'. This, along with the upfront costs is putting people off having a viable and valuable asset to generate power installed. By giving access to 'up-front' funds at Zero interest, would encourage more domestic Solar installations. Fully self-funding by submission of a second meter reading at a substantially reduced kw/h rate, payback for a typical family is 6 years where 'tandem billing' finishes. Repaid funds can be then reused again for other causes.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.  We're not sure whether you want the Government to fund free renewable technology or to finance loans, because the text of your petition includes both.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: No to Rushi Sunak as Prime Minister
attributes.background: Let the people have their say with their vote! Boris was voted by the people but glad he has stepped down. We want to elect a new Prime minister and we do not want Rishi Sunak forced on us!
attributes.additional_details: We are tired of suffering! We want someone who understands the living situation in the present economy! Someone who would make it illegal for energy companies to refuse collecting new customers which is currently aiding in skyrocketing the energy prices! We want someone who would not increase taxes especially council taxes! Someone who understands how to guide the country successfully out of recession and not just sit and watch us plummet into recession! No free money distribution! Curb Energy

rejection.details: We can't accept petitions about appointments, which includes petitions relating to who becomes the new Prime Minister.

attributes.action: Stop the ULEZ expansion to Greater London in August 2023
attributes.background: Government need to at a minimum delay the ULEZ coming to Greater London for a few years. The majority of these people cannot afford to replace their cars if they are not compliant. Having seen an increase in the cost of living, energy and fuel amongst other things, & our wages not reflecting this.
attributes.additional_details: Since COVID the economy has taken a hit, which the taxpayers are paying for. I also appreciate we have a duty to be net zero by 2050. A year to replace 1000's of cars that are not compliant, the manufacturers already have waiting lists for new cars so they can't meet the demand. There is a shortage in second-hand cars. £12.50 per day to drive is extortionate, the unemployment rate will rise as people can't afford to get to work. People don't have the finances to accommodate all these increases.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. It is the responsibility of the Mayor of London and the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Revoke local government powers to charge CAZ, LEZ, ZEZ and ULEZ: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/618266

attributes.action: Ban Electronic Waterboarding
attributes.background: Havana Syndrome is caused by electronic devices used to modify, cower or intimidate a victim. Pulsed electromagnetic energy assaults are a type of torture that the unscrupulous can use against their victims to achieve an aim the Law would otherwise not grant them. Such devices should be banned.
attributes.additional_details: Faced with the cost of living crisis such technology could be easily deployed outside of the Law against citizens whether tenants that a landlord wants out or the security apparatus when they want to intimidate peaceful protesters. It is imperative that these devices and their use be banned regardless of any consideration of necessity, proportionality, justification or temporary damage and the users punished, rather than exist for years and only be recognised after their use has been borne out.

rejection.details: The use of torture is already illegal. In any case we can't publish petitions that include unproven allegations.

attributes.action: More money invested into renewable energy sources
attributes.background: As a part of the 2008 Climate Change Act, the government must invest more money into renewable energy sources.
attributes.additional_details: The government isn’t putting enough money into their schemes. Included in the 2008 act is a pledge to reach net zero by 2050. This will simply not happen if the government doesn’t invest more money into increasing renewable energy sources, and support scientists in discovering how we can make these sources more efficient. This is why we are demanding significantly increased funding and investment, so that we can save our planet before it's too late.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617729

attributes.action: Help all consumers to access, and benefit from, remotely harvested solar energy.
attributes.background: By creating a, legislated and regulated as necessary, framework within which, using the remotely sited ‘solar farm’ model, all domestic and commercial consumers can easily invest in sufficient panel space to meet their own needs. So for low investment, everyone can provide their own energy supply.
attributes.additional_details: Everything to enable this, quickly, exists except a national strategy or framework that makes this easy and accessible to all. The benefits are many; cost, self-sufficiency, savings to the public purse, and can lead to carbon zero, with greater use of electric heat management and electric cars.  This will remove the current haphazard, individual approach taken by householders, organisations and other bodies.  This is not a call for any form of nationalisation.

attributes.action: End net zero and green levies on our energy bills.
attributes.background: Net zero is being paid for by inflating our gas and electricity bills. Wind turbines are NOT FREE. We are all paying for them. We the tax paying people were never asked if we wanted to go green.
attributes.additional_details:
We want the government to reduce our energy bills instead of throwing millions into fuel poverty by paying for expensive unreliable energy. When the wind doesn't blow and the sun has gone down renewable energy is useless. The energy we use should be reliable and cheap. Our energy should come from North Sea gas and oil and be refined here in the UK.
We also need to increase our capacity for refining gas and oil.
The transition to green energy should be natural as it gets cheaper in the future.

attributes.action: Force energy companies to abolish the Standing Charge
attributes.background: I want a law introduced that makes energy firms responsible for the upkeep for the infrastructure not to pass it on by an unfair charge that only benefits them and their shareholders. Ofgem does not seem to have the teeth/ power to make this happen so its time Parliament backed the people for once
attributes.additional_details: Example, when I get on a bus they driver does not say that will be a £1 please oh and an extra 10p for the oil and to cover tyre replacement, no everything is tied up in a single price and for that I get the trip I need, likewise with the extortionate profits the energy firms make they can upkeep the infrastructure first from profits not using the standing charge as a way to boost profits, then they can pay dividends second third etc. Other business have to show inclusive charges why not them?

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Decisions about standing charges are a matter for utility providers and Ofgem, not the UK Government or Parliament.

The price cap is a cap on a unit of gas and electricity, with standing charges taken into account. Find out more about the energy price cap, including how it includes standing charges, here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/check-if-energy-price-cap-affects-you

attributes.background:
It would be good if there was more days between Friday and Monday. Or extra weekend days. This could be done in alternating weeks, such as every other week we have a longer weekend.

attributes.action: Improve the cost of living for people of England.

Price caps on fuel, energy bills/prices, food, health care.
Evaluation of the cost of living with the wages we are given to live off, no matter which profession an individual is based off.

Inflation is causing families, elderly and children to go hungry and cold due to inadequate care from the government.

The people of England are not being supported by our government, for the rights we deserve. Inflation is causing us people to become hopeless, depressed and even loathe the government and their lack of support to the British public.
